intro: Brassaiopsis calcarea, commonly known as the rock lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers, which are usually white or pale yellow, bloom in spring and are followed by capsule fruits. Brassaiopsis calcarea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in challenging conditions.
